description: Reference of methods implemented by API
title: API Reference File

___$schema.description: Link to schema for this reference. That is a link to this very document. Typically used to identify what kind of reference this file is.
___$schema.title: Schema Reference

___entries.description: Array of methods in this reference
___entries.title: Entries

___name.description: Name of the `function` this is a stable identifier for use in auto-generated client libraries

___description.description: Description (ie. documentation) for the API entry

___output.description: JSON schema for output, if output is provided otherwise not present.

___scopes.description: List of scope-sets of which the client must satisfy at least one of the sets of scopes. Not provided if authentication isn't required.

items.description: A set of scopes that grants access if all the scopes in the set is satisfied.  Scopes must be composed of printable ASCII characters and spaces.

___args.description: Arguments from `route` that must be replaced, they'll appear wrapped in brackets inside `route`.

items.description: Argument that appears in `route` warpped in angle brackets. It must be replaced to call the function.

___method.description: HTTP method (verb) used to access the function

___route.description: Route for the call, note that arguments wrapped with brackets, like `/v1/user/<userId>/` must be replaced. And the route must be appended to the `baseUrl`

___input.description: JSON schema for input, if input is taken otherwise not present.

___baseUrl.description: BaseUrl for all _routes_ described in this document
